title: Graduate Researcher
employer: National Institute of Standards and Technology
comments: Measuring LTE and 5G devices and developing algorithms for the detection of anomalies in communications systems.
Developed measurement techniques a python software suite for automated wide-band wireless virtual array measurements and analysis with the NIST SAMURAI system.
Learned established measurement tools, techniques, and calibrations for providing traceable measurements.

title: PhD Candidate
comments: Researching the usage of Monte Carlo techniques to improve channel estimation for 5G millimeter-wave wireless communication systems
Developed and verified software to simulate hardware and large-scale phased arrays in measured propagation environments to evaluate channel estimators in 5G millimeter-Wave communications systems.
Accelerated simulations of phased array hardware and electromagnetic simulations with multiple CPUs and GPUs using python, C, and CUDA.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
comments: Simulated electromagnetic propagation using finite difference time domain (FDTD) algorithms, including high-order algorithms for improved accuracy.
Implemented electromagnetic simulations using FDTD on GPUs and a supercomputer using FORTRAN, C, CUDA and MPI with SLURM.
Integrated complex CAD models into electromagnetic simulations using high-order algorithms by leveraging existing software.

title: Summer Intern
comments: Helped coordinate the development of spaceflight subsystems for future human space launch systems
Worked with a team to analyze accidents and errors that occurred during the construction and launch of aerospace systems.
Advancing professional skills and experience by solving problems teams of engineers from various backgrounds

title: Teaching Assistant
comments: Worked with new students to design and build open ended engineering design projects to help in the local community.
Mentored student's professional skills and design experience to help them get started in their college careers as engineering students.

title: Rocket Sat X EPS Team Member
position: Rocket Sat X EPS Team Member
comments: Developed an electronic system to inductively melt aluminum in under a minute.
Manufactured PCBs and circuit peripherals to track and store sensor measurements from the system.

title: Sales Associate
comments: Assisted customers in finding shoes that matched their applications.
